result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick R Berzinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
------------------------------
**09-17-2018 AMENDMENT - 95 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT DUE PURSUANT TO s.973.155, WIS. STATS., AMENDED TO 97 DAYS.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medications without valid prescription and must be taken within limits as prescribed. No contact with Lisa Sharp.
----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------
Ongoing alcohol and drug counseling as determined by the Department.
----------------------------------
Must attend Victim Impact Panel.
----------------------------------

Cooperate with any mental health treatment.
----------------------------------

supervisions.notes: Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to February 26, 2018.

3:36 pm  Attorney Megan Sanders-Drazen in court for Defendant Rick R Berzinski. Prosecuting Atty Robert J Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rick R Berzinski appeared by video means from Prairie du Chien Correctional.
3:37 pm  State has submitted a brief in response to Defense motion and does agree defendant is entitled to an additional two days dead time.
3:37 pm  Argument by Attorney Sanders-Drazen.
3:46 pm  Attorney Jambois continues to oppose motion.
3:46 pm  Court makes a record of factors he took into consideration when imposing sentence.
Court believes record is clear and for the reasons stated on the record, denies post-conviction motion.
Court will grant additional two days dead time credit.
Attorney Sanders-Drazen will prepare an order and submit under five-day rule.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to December 27, 2017.

Court Reporter Rhonda Boss

Status Conference before the Honorable James Carlson on April 6, 2015
Court Reporter Rhonda Boss

Court Reporter Rhonda Boss

Sentencing Hearing before the Honorable Phillip Koss on August 8, 2016
Court Reporter Sandy Elderbrook

Initial Appearance before the Honorable Daniel Johnson on January 14, 2015

Waiver of Prelim, Arraignment before the Honorable Phillip Koss on January 30, 2015
Court Reporter Janet Schulz

IT IS ORDERED that the motion to reinstate WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 appeal rights from an August 2016 sentencing is granted.  The notice of intent to puruse postconviction relief filed on January 23, 2017 is deemed timely filed.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to act under either WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(e) or (f) commences as of the date of this order.
IT IS ORDERED that no later than May 18, 2017, the State shall advise whether it objects to the motion to reinstate the defendant's WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 appeal rights.

IT IS ORDERED that no later than April 5, 2017, an affidavit of service of this motion upon the Attorney General shall be filed.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to reinstate the WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 appeal rights is held in abeyance pending compliance with this order.

Application for Jail Time Credit form
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Rick R Berzinski in court, in custody with attorney Ashley L Renz.  DDA Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 11:03 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing. The Court has reviewed the PSI, and other sentencing materials. Court turns to Atty. Renz for any PSI corrections. Atty. Renz makes a record of 2 corrections. 
11:05 a.m. - Argument by DDA Johnson.
11:11 a.m. - Argument by Atty. Renz
11:17 a.m. - Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Court takes short recess.
11:25 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Defendant responds to Court's questions. Court makes a record including sentencing guidelines, makes a finding,  and sentences the defendant as follows:

TEN (10) YEARS IN THE WISCONSIN STATE PRISON WITH FIVE (5) YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT FOLLWED BY FIVE (5) YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION with the following conditions:
*Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
*No alcohol or illegal drugs. No prescription mediations without valid prescription and must be taken within limits as prescribed.
*No contact with Lisa Sharp
*Ongoing alcohol and drug counseling as determined by the Department
*Cooperate with any mental health treatment
*Must attend a victim impact panel
*Three (3) years revocation of driver's license
*Three (3) years IID

THE DEFENDANT HAS 95 DAYS OF DEADTIME CREDIT
Court provides defendant warnings as to deportation, voting rights, firearms.
Parties have nothing further. 
Court in recess @ 11:41 a.m.
**Transcript filed on 12-16-2016**  (ls)

Defendant Rick R Berzinski in court with attorney Ashley L Renz.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 10:10 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pre-trial. Atty. Renz informs the Court that defendant will plead guilty as charged, requests PSI, and matter be set over for sentencing. Response by Atty. Leusink. Court goes over plea paperwork with the defendant. Defendant and attorneys respond to Court's questions. Defendant's bond is revoked and he is taken into custody. 
COURT ORDERS PSI AND MATTER IS SET OVER FOR SENTENCING.
Court in recess @ 10:18 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
